intro: Fimbristylis sansibariensis, commonly known as the East African sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowering stems bear small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Fimbristylis sansibariensis plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for small organisms.
